DOC.brief_summary: Objective study : To determine whether Perioperative Auto-CPAP treatment prevent postoperative worsening OSA improve nocturnal oxygen saturation surgical patient moderate severe OSA .
DOC.brief_title: The Effectiveness Perioperative CPAP Reduce Obstructive Sleep Apnea Related Adverse Events
DOC.detailed_description: The patient approach study coordinator preoperative clinic . If patient interested participating study , STOP-Bang Epworth questionnaire implement determine risk OSA.If patient classify high risk OSA , schedule overnight sleep study home . The patient Apnea-Hypopnea Index ( AHI ) > 15 sleep study randomize two study group : Perioperative CPAP group control group ( routine care ) . In perioperative CPAP group , patient treat auto-CPAP 2-3 night preoperatively 5 night postoperatively . All patient undergo sleep study third postoperative night monitor pulse oximeter 2-3 night preoperatively 5 night postoperatively .
DOC.criteria: patient meet follow criterion recruit Patients schedule inpatient surgery require minimum three night hospital stay Age : > 18 < 80 year old . Identified high risk OSA diagnose OSA without use CPAP . Undergoing nasal , eye , head/neck surgery , intracranial cardiac/thoracic surgery . Unwilling unable give inform consent . Currently undergo treatment sleep apnea include CPAP . Requiring prolonged postoperative ventilation . New York Heart Association functional class III IV . Having valvular heart disease , dilate cardiomyopathy , implanted cardiac pacemaker , unstable angina . Having myocardial infarction cardiac surgery within 3 month . Having chronic obstructive pulmonary disease , asthma . Having presence tracheostomy , facial , neck , chest wall abnormality . Having abdominal aortic aneurysm surgery , chemotherapy , immunosuppressive therapy within 3 month . Visiting preoperative clinic le 3 day schedule surgery date . On nasogastric tube postoperatively .
